channel.title: development on underWater desert Blogging
channel.description: Recent content in development on underWater desert Blogging

item.title: The Latent, Natural Synergies Between Virtual Currencies, Open Data Schemes, and International Development
item.description: I like it when disparate things work well together. Like fish farming and hydroponic vegetable growing for instance (aka aquaponics). I see some increasing levels of synergy between virtual currencies, open data schemes and international development. Here's why.

item.title: On Chasing Chaos: The best book about "The Life" I've read in ages.
item.description: Chasing Chaos examines the lives that aid workers lead and the work which aid workers do in vivid clarity and with honesty, clarity, and warmth. Highly recommended book; and not only because I know Jess.

item.title: Taking the E out of M&E for Governance Projects
item.description: A thought exploration of to more properly evaluate governance projects for international development. The title may be clickbait, as the post is less about taking the E out of M&E and more about making the case for the E coming a reasonable amount of time after the project is completed.

item.title: For Business or for Pleasure: Which is Aid?
item.description: Two articles were published this week on opposite sides of an interesting debate, what is the role of profit in the deployment of development services? I think that they both slightly miss the mark and here's why…
